comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Lawn Party on Governors Island in New York harbor was an annual fundraising event for the Army Relief Society, which provided succor to widows and orphans of officers and enlisted men of the regular army. Henry L. Stimson, the newly-appointed Secretary of War, attended this affair on May 25, 1911. Here is another photo of Stimson with General Grant: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2163471766/in/p...

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: Wystan: Thanks for pinning down the event and tying this and related images together.  We'll add information when we update the descriptions.
